all_text_timv: A dark song / IFC Midnight, Samson Films, and Tall Man Films present ; in association with Bord Scannán Na Héireann / The Irish Film Board ; in association with FFILM Cymru wales CBC ; producers: David Collins, Tim Dennison ,Cormac Fox ; written and directed by Liam Gavin. [United States] : Scream Factory, [2017] ©2017 1 videodisc (100 min.) : sound, color ; 4 3/4 in. two-dimensional moving image tdi rdacontent video v rdamedia videodisc vd rdacarrier digital optical rda NTSC rda video file DVD video rda Motion picture. Title from disc surface. Originally released as a motion picture in 2016. Widescreen. Special features: interviews with director, actors, director of photography; deleted scenes; storyboards; theatrical trailer. Original score by Ray Harman ; production design by Conor Dennison ; director of photography, Cathal Watters ; costume designer Kathy Strachan ; editor, Anna Maria O'Flanagan. Catherine Walker, Steve Oram, Mark Huberman, Susan Loughnane. An unholy alliance between two damaged souls leads them on a disturbing descent into the depraved realms of black magic. Sophia is a grieving mother desperate to make contact with her murdered son. Joseph is an anti-social, alcoholic expert in the occult who reluctantly agrees to help her. Holed up in a remote house amidst the desolate wilds of Northern Wales, the two embark on a grueling six-month series of dark rituals that will push them both to the physical and psychological breaking point. Rating: Not rated. DVD, region 1, widescreen presentation, Dolby Digital 5.1. Purchased with funds from the  Irene J. Wernstedt Library Acquisition Fund; 2017 English dialogue; English subtitles. Occultism Drama. Demonology Drama. Mothers and sons Drama. Mothers of murder victims Drama.
